title: Copyright Boilerplate
content:
Does anyone have the verbiage for a copyright statement that includes multiple owners? I’m doing a high school literary yearbook with text and art contributions from several students. I’d like to have some kind of copyright notice on back of title page. Currently I have a placeholder... “Copyright (c) 2009 by XYZ High School. All rights reserved”.... I’d like to include the contributors too, but would prefer to have some kind of blanket verbiage — and not name them all.

Any ideas?

Thanks.
author: peterpica

comments.content:
The copyright is usually reserved for the single owner of the whole publication. Contributors of content are usually noted per item, or in a section of acknowledgments where copyright(s) of included work(s) are stated.

Cheers!
